Having been in business for three years, Whoosh NG has fulfilled more than 20,000 deliveries locally and globally. However, Whoosh NG is evolving from the conventional business space to become a Logistics Technology Company

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Balangu Lagos and WhooshNG are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Finance Officer to join our growing teams.
	The ideal candidate will manage daily financial operations, support budgeting and reporting processes, and ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial information across both businesses.
	This role requires strong analytical skills, excellent knowledge of finance principles, and hands-on experience with modern financial tools.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Management &amp; Reporting:


	Prepare, analyze, and maintain accurate financial statements and reports.
	Assist in monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes.
	Reconcile bank statements, accounts payable/receivable, and general ledger entries.
	Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and external regulatory requirements.


Budgeting &amp; Forecasting:


	Support the development of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
	Monitor expenditure vs. budget and provide variance analysis.
	Advise management on financial performance and cost control opportunities.


Cash Flow &amp; Treasury Management:


	Track daily cash flow and ensure adequate liquidity for operations.
	Process payments, manage petty cash, and maintain treasury records.


Financial Tools &amp; Systems:


	Utilize financial management tools for bookkeeping, reporting, and analysis.
	Maintain and update accounting software and financial databases.
	Generate automated reports using modern financial systems and Excel tools.


Compliance &amp; Audit Support:


	Prepare documentation for internal and external audits.
	Ensure adherence to tax laws, statutory filings, and financial regulations.
	Maintain proper documentation and archiving of financial records.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in a finance or accounting role.
	Strong proficiency in financial tools such as:
	
		QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books, or similar accounting software
		Microsoft Excel (advanced functions preferred)
		Financial reporting dashboards or ERP tools
	
	
	Solid understanding of financial regulations and accounting principles.
	Excellent analytical and numerical skills.
	High attention to detail and strong organizational ability.
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks simultaneously


Preferred Attributes:


	Experience working within FMCG, food service, logistics, or e-commerce environments.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Integrity, reliability, and a results-driven mindset.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@whoosh.com.ng&nbsp;using &quot;Finance Officer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Finance Officer Job at Whoosh Logistics




        
    

        
        Whoosh NG is an thriving logistics business with one of the best operations processes, structure and outlook in the SME category in Lagos State. Having been in business for three years, Whoosh NG has fulfilled more than 20,000 deliveries locally and globally. However, Whoosh NG is evolving from the conventional business space to become a Logistics Technology Company

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role

	Balangu Lagos and WhooshNG are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Finance Officer to join our growing teams.
	The ideal candidate will manage daily financial operations, support budgeting and reporting processes, and ensure the accuracy and integrity of financial information across both businesses.
	This role requires strong analytical skills, excellent knowledge of finance principles, and hands-on experience with modern financial tools.


Key Responsibilities
Financial Management & Reporting:


	Prepare, analyze, and maintain accurate financial statements and reports.
	Assist in monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes.
	Reconcile bank statements, accounts payable/receivable, and general ledger entries.
	Ensure compliance with internal financial policies and external regulatory requirements.


Budgeting & Forecasting:


	Support the development of annual budgets and financial forecasts.
	Monitor expenditure vs. budget and provide variance analysis.
	Advise management on financial performance and cost control opportunities.


Cash Flow & Treasury Management:


	Track daily cash flow and ensure adequate liquidity for operations.
	Process payments, manage petty cash, and maintain treasury records.


Financial Tools & Systems:


	Utilize financial management tools for bookkeeping, reporting, and analysis.
	Maintain and update accounting software and financial databases.
	Generate automated reports using modern financial systems and Excel tools.


Compliance & Audit Support:


	Prepare documentation for internal and external audits.
	Ensure adherence to tax laws, statutory filings, and financial regulations.
	Maintain proper documentation and archiving of financial records.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of proven experience in a finance or accounting role.
	Strong proficiency in financial tools such as:
	
		QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books, or similar accounting software
		Microsoft Excel (advanced functions preferred)
		Financial reporting dashboards or ERP tools
	
	
	Solid understanding of financial regulations and accounting principles.
	Excellent analytical and numerical skills.
	High attention to detail and strong organizational ability.
	Ability to work independently and handle multiple tasks simultaneously


Preferred Attributes:


	Experience working within FMCG, food service, logistics, or e-commerce environments.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Integrity, reliability, and a results-driven mindset.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@whoosh.com.ng using "Finance Officer" as the subject of the email.

Business Development Manager Job at Contec Global Group




        
    

        
        Contec Global Group - Established in 1984 and headquartered in London, the Contec Global Group has a worldwide presence, with operations in Asia, Africa, and Europe. As a company established on the platform of e-Governance and smart technologies, Contec Global is among the most experienced independent technology and systems organizations operating in developing countries. Today, the Group is engaged, globally, in providing integrated, systems-based solutions in the fields of Secure Technologies, Infrastructure, and Hospitality.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Description


	Are you a driven professional who thrives on building new business and driving growth?
	Contec Global Agro is seeking a results-oriented Business Development Manager to join our dynamic team in Abuja.
	This role is pivotal to our expansion strategy, focusing on identifying new market opportunities, forging strategic partnerships, and increasing our footprint in Nigeria's agro-industrial sector.


Key Responsibilities


	Market Penetration: Identify, target, and secure new clients and business opportunities within the agro-allied industry (e.g., inputs, produce, processing).
	Strategic Partnerships: Develop and negotiate partnerships with key stakeholders, including distributors, suppliers, corporate farms, and government agencies.
	Revenue Growth: Drive sales and achieve set targets for revenue and market share by promoting our portfolio of agro-products and services.
	Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong, long-lasting relationships with key accounts, ensuring high levels of client satisfaction.
	Market Intelligence: Conduct thorough market research to understand trends, competitor activities, and identify new areas for business development.
	Proposal Development: Prepare and present compelling business proposals and presentations to potential clients and partners.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Agriculture, Marketing, or a related field.
	A minimum of 7 years of proven business development or sales experience, preferably within the Agriculture/Agro-allied sector in Nigeria.
	A strong existing network of contacts within the Nigerian agro-sector is highly desirable.
	Demonstrable track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets and driving revenue growth.
	Excellent negotiation, communication, and presentation skills.
	Strategic thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
	Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 monthly.
